title: Make spark-rapids-jni SNAPSHOT pinable to absorb breaking changes in a controlled manner

labels.name: build
labels.description: Related to CI / CD or cleanly building

body:
We occasionally make breaking changes deliberately or accidentally in spark-rapids-jni/cudf manifesting itself in the broken pre-merge or  compile process.

To reduce disruptions in unrelated work streams in spark-rapids, we should implement for spark-rapids a mechanims pinning of spark-rapids-jni SNAPSHOT similar in spirit to cudf pins in spark-rapids-jni itself.

 We could use a git sha as part of the SNAPSHOT version https://maven.apache.org/maven-ci-friendly.html

A regular "sync" job then attempts to advance the dependency to a recent HEAD ${sha} of spark-rapids-jni making sure it does not break the build and pre-merge in spark-rapids.

If there is a situation  where a PR like https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids-jni/pull/2047 is breaking the downstream by design. The corresponding downstream PR such as  https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/pull/10833 updates the sha part of spark-rapids-jni to pick up the spark-rapids-jni with the necessary upstream API changes. It is able to pass the pre-merge and gets in.

While this is happening unrelated dev work can proceed without seeing disruptions and having to do manual pining locally
